reviews.review_msg: I was surprised by the amount of work this course had. She covered a lot of material so it was hard to follow at times but it was interesting overall.
The class was amazing. I don't know how she did it! If you need an elective, that's your course!!!!!!!
Excellent prof, great seminars. It was a very engaging course!
Lots of work, not easy for a student who is not in Humanities

Eirini is probably  one of the most open minded and engaging professors I have ever taken a course with.  Her lectures and essay assignments are long, but you get a lot of freedom during class discussion and in choosing how to go about your paper topic. If you need an elective course, I recommend that you take one with Eirini. Be prepared to read!

This professor should NOT be teaching. She only appreciates work that is unoriginal and regurgitative, and rejects anything outside of 'approved' methods of thinking (even though this was a course on the avant-garde).  The people in the class were incredibly interesting/intelligent, but from the sound of it there was about a C-ish average. AVOID!
